alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 30 at 4:05PM MST until June 30 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Santa Cruz County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 700 PM MST. * At 405 PM MST, Heavy rain fell upstream from the town of Patagonia and a significant flood wave is moving down Sonoita Creek and headed to Patagonia Lake. The Creak rose 14 feet in Patagonia in a short period of time and this flood crest will continue moving south. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Stay away from the Sonoita Creek and be prepared for a significant surge of water entering Patagonia Lake. SOURCE...Radar and automated river gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of Sonoita Creek. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Patagonia Lake State Park. This includes the following highways... Route 82 between mile markers 14 and 15. This includes the following streams and drainages... Sonoita Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
